sentence.Network_en: Her manner offstage, like her manner on, is somewhat surly.

sentence.Network_en: We go offstage and come back for the convention of the encore.
sentence.Network_cn: 按照加演的传统做法，我们走到后台后又再次返场。

sentence.Network_en: There was a lot of noise offstage.

entry.def: When an actor or entertainer goes offstage, they go into the area behind or to the side of the stage, so that the audience no longer sees them.

example.ex: There was a lot of noise offstage.

entry.tran: （戏剧中声效）来自后台的，出自舞台表演区外的
entry.def: In a theatre, offstage sounds are produced behind or to the side of the stage, so that the audience hears them but does not see them produced.

example.ex: It's almost one o'clock!' lamented the off-stage voice.
example.tran: “快一点钟了！”从幕后传来一声悲叹。

entry.tran: （演员、表演者）台下的，现实生活中的
entry.def: Offstage is used to describe the behaviour of actors or entertainers in real life, when they are not performing.

means.word_mean: 1. a stage area out of sight of the audience
1. situated or taking place in the area of a stage not visible to the audience;
2. withheld from public view or attention;
1. behind the scenes; not on stage;
